etymologies: late 16th century: apparently a translation of Low German or Dutch hoenderbeet

definitions: a dead-nettle with purple flowers and partly prostrate stems, native to Eurasia, several kinds of which have become widely naturalized in North America.

notes.text: Genus Lamium, family Labiatae: several species, in particular L. amplexicaule

shortDefinitions: dead-nettle with purple flowers and partly prostrate stems, native to Eurasia
